question: Recently,  Ministry of Road Transport and Highways advised the States and Union Territories to stamp "International Convention of Road Traffic" on the first page of International Driving Permit (IDP) issued by them. In which year, this convention was concluded?
explanation: Recently,  Ministry of Road Transport and Highways (MoRTH) has advised the States and Union Territories to stamp "International Convention of Road Traffic" on the first page of International Driving Permit (IDP) issued by them because many countries are not accepting the International Driving Permit issued to Indian citizens and ask for the validation of IDP in accordance of International Convention of Road Traffic. This convention is an International treaty for promoting safety of international traffic by making certain uniform rules for the contracting parties and is also known as the Geneva Convention on Road Traffic. It was signed in 1949 and came into force in 1952.
